greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Row index to A255127: a(1) = 0; for n > 1, a(n) = number of the stage where n is removed in the sieve which produces Ludic numbers.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10105
formula: a(A003309(n)) = n-1. [In Ludic sieve A003309(k+1) (i.e., the k-th Ludic number after 1) is the first among the numbers removed at stage k.]
a(2n) = 1. [All even numbers are removed at the stage one of the sieve.]
program: (define (A260738 n) (cond ((= 1 n) 0) ((even? n) 1) (else (let searchrow ((row 2)) (let searchcol ((col 1)) (cond ((>= (A255127bi row col) n) (if (= (A255127bi row col) n) row (searchrow (+ 1 row)))) (else (searchcol (+ 1 col))))))))) ;; Code for A255127bi given in A255127.
xref: Cf. A055396, A260438 for row indices to other arrays similar to A255127.
Differs from A055396 for the first time at n=19.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 30 2015
